description.narrative: By 2016, key GoB and C4D partners implement behaviour and social change interventions that increase knowledge and commitment to 7 KHHP among 60% of community members in 3 upazillas of each of the 20 UNDAF districts

related-activity.ref: 5070/A0/04/003 PCR 3. PRACTICE KEY LIFE SAVING BEHAVIOU

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, key GoB and C4D partners implement behaviour and social change interventions that increase knowledge and commitment to 7 KHHP among 60% of community members in 3 upazillas of each of the 20 UNDAF districts

description.narrative: Significant positive changes reported in knowledge and practice levels among mothers, fathers and adolescents in relation to ANC/PNC visits, IFA tablet consumption, handwashing with soap, birth registration in 45 days, and ending child marriage, child labour and corporal punishment. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2016

title.narrative: Percent of caregivers (mother, father, grandmother) that can state 3 benefits of 8 key behaviours

actual.value: 2016:As per the findings of the 2016 End-line Survey conducted by JPG School of Public Health, BRAC University: • 53% of mothers of under-6-month-old children, 57% of mothers of under-five-years-old children and 25% of fathers at sentinel sites can state 3 benefits of 4 ANC visits during pregnancy, which
